definition: to offer/to present/to dedicate/to donate/to show/to put on display/worthy person (old)
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: Above his head is a Latin inscription.
sentences.chinese: 他的头上是一段拉丁语献词。

sentences.english: The President's attitude toward the proposals had been indicated in his New Year's address.
sentences.chinese: 总统对那些建议的态度已在他的新年献词中表明。

sentences.english: We can put the dedication at the top of the page.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以把献词写在这页的上方。

sentences.english: Those who go to churches can solemnly renew their dedication to God for the coming year.
sentences.chinese: 去教堂的人可以向上帝献上他们新的献词。

definition: to make a speech/to make some remarks
variant of 頌詞|颂词[song4 ci2]
to mourn/to pay last respects/mourning/memorial (service etc)
to offer humbly (written at the end of letter from sb of lower status to higher status)/your humble servant
